title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 October 2014 - XWiki
content:

08:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vmassol> good morning  
09:17 <cjd> gm  
09:17 <cjd> how's your hand?  
09:17 <vmassol> I don't see much difference from before unfortunately...  
09:17 <vmassol> thanks for asking  
09:18 <cjd> what did the doctor do? stretch the muscles out?  
09:18 <vmassol> they did this: http://www.hopital-dcss.org/soins-services-hopital/informations-medicales/item/194-traiter-maladie-dupuytren-sans-operer-aponevrotomie-percutanee-aiguille.html  
09:18 <vmassol> with the needle  
09:19 <vmassol> fig 9-12  
09:20 <cjd> ahh ok..  
09:20 <tmortagne> not scary at all...  
09:20 <vmassol> less than the surgery option  
09:20 <tmortagne> depends if you sleep during the surgery :)  
09:21 <vmassol> oh you're injected some anestesia  in both cases  
09:21 <vmassol> locally  
09:22 <tmortagne> yea that's what is not fun with things like this, you don't get to sleep  
09:22 <cjd> N2O way more fun  
09:22 <vmassol> actually with the surgery it's the whole arm that gets dumb  
09:22 <tmortagne> ok  
09:22 <vmassol> in my case I got 4 shots of anestesia, one per finger  
09:22 <vmassol> (per finger to treat)  
09:23 <vmassol> ok let's go back to xwiki stuff :)  
09:23 <vmassol> one more week till the 6.3M2 release :)  
09:24 <vmassol> Updated http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseManagerRoster with the newt 2 releases coming up  
09:24 <vmassol> \*next  
09:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: FTR I"ve been working on upgrading to jetty9 over the weekend, I wanted to try this https://webtide.com/jetty-9-quick-start/  
09:26 <vmassol> still need to do some experiments before committing  
09:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
09:29 <tmortagne> pushing a big plumbing (but still internal) change on my side, hope I won't break too much stuff  
09:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki

10:02 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <vmassol> guys check http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DownloadFormFeedback I've just added the latest feedback received  
10:11 <tmortagne> yea modified filesystem files is not the easiest thing to migrate but hard to find a solution for these except making sure that it's not needed to modify those as he said  
10:18 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <lucaa> has quit  
11:22 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <gdelhumeau> guys  
11:30 <gdelhumeau> I have an idea for: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11206  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> It is removing the @media properties in the CSS insude the wysisyg iframe for IE9  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> But I need to write a lexer/parser for that (regular expression is not enought)  
11:31 <gdelhumeau> do you think it is ok?  
11:31 <cjd> regex is always enough :D  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> cjd: I need a regexp that match @media \* { .bla{..} }  
11:32 <evalica> gdelhumeau: maybe we should drop support for IE9 instead :) I don't know how to help you  
11:32 <cjd> and removes it ?  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> cjd: where it could be a infinine number of .bla inside the {} of @media  
11:32 <cjd> right  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> yes cjd  
11:32 <cjd> what language?  
11:32 <gdelhumeau> My first attempt was: $css.replaceAll('(?s)@media[^\{]\*\{[^\}]\*\}', ''))  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> velocity/java  
11:33 <cjd> :D  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> but obviously, it have found the first "}" following the media  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> not the } that CLOSES the media rule  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> I don't know how to do that with a reg exp  
11:34 <Pbas> has quit  
11:34 <gdelhumeau> It does not look like a finite state machine  
11:34 <cjd> /nod  
11:34 <gdelhumeau> because I have to count the number of "{" and "}" to find the closing "}"  
11:35 <gdelhumeau> an other option is to create a javascript that removes the media queries if it is inside the wysiwyg iframe and with IE9  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> so I can use the CSS engine of IE instead of writing a parser  
11:36 <cjd> that's probably preferable  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> do you agree that a regexp can't do the job?  
11:36 <cjd> yeah  
11:36 <cjd> I have code which does basically that, it uses a switch statement in a loop with regex  
11:37 <gdelhumeau> I'm going to try the JS approach  
11:37 <cjd> generally a good policy ;)  
11:46 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <Lyes> has quit  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> cjd: it works !  
12:18 <cjd> :)  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> ah no  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> I still had the velocity trick  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> yes it works  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> wysiwyginput.vm was not using javascript.vm

16:01 <Enygma`> after building locally xwiki-platform-oldcore and deploying it in the webapp, I get this at startup: http://hastebin.com/gelasigaba.avrasm  
16:01 <Enygma`> trying to access the wiki I get a browser error that "The page isn't redirecting properly"  
16:01 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <Enygma`> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Failed to get fields for class [org.xwiki.extension.distribution.internal.job.step.AbstractDistributionStep] because the class [Lcom/xpn/xwiki/internal/template/WikiTemplateRenderer;] couldn't be found in the ClassLoader.  
16:02 <tmortagne> Enygma`: looks like you are not fully up to date  
16:02 <tmortagne> WikiTemplateRenderer has been renamed in oldcore  
16:03 <silverdrop> has quit  
16:03 <tmortagne> or you are too up to date in oldcore when compared to the rest of you WAR, depends of the point of view  
16:04 <Enygma`> my war is from Friday  
16:04 <Enygma`> was it changed recently?  
16:05 <tmortagne> yep, I renamed WikiTemplateRenderer this morning  
16:05 <tmortagne> see Velocity chat about my merge  
16:05 <tmortagne> Skype  
16:05 <Enygma`> ok, I will update my binaries then, thanks  
16:07 <tmortagne> note: there is a little issue with my merge and macro.vm handling (does not seems too bad since platform is fully building on jenkins so I guess it should not block you)  
16:08 <vmassol> tmortagne: just built enterprise and it fails on the first request  
16:08 <vmassol> tons of the following:  
16:08 <vmassol> Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource '/skins/XWiki.DefaultSkin/macros.vm'  
16:10 <tmortagne> yes that's what I'm working on, it's fixed but I have to fix some badly written tests  
16:10 <vmassol> ok  
16:12 <AFKGeek> has quit  
16:18 <Enygma`> yeah, same issue reported by vmassol is biting me now, instance is not starting...  
16:26 <tmortagne> its weird that all platform ui test are passing, anyway it's fixed now, just building oldcore one last time and committing  
16:30 <tmortagne> should be better now  
16:30 <tmortagne> vmassol, Enygma`  
16:32 <Enygma`> tmortagne: cool, pulling
